what will success do for you once you acquire it? This simply seems like any other attachment to desire with a strong pull towards that outcome. Desire is not bad or problematic, desire is simply an attraction to something that you don't currently have. If you had it you wouldn't desire it. You can desire a new glass to put water in, but that desire doesn't seem as strong as other desires you may have such as success, women, or a new computer. So there is a difference in the quality or depth of desire. The one difference is the level of attachment to the desire, if you strongly desire something you will expend a tremendous amount of energy towards that goal but really what will this goal give you that you do not already have? this is the core question that must be asked

why do "joy, excitement, bliss, and ecstacy" classify as positive emotions in the first place? Why are depression, anxiety, fear classified as negative emotion? We place these labels on feelings we desire and don't desire. When in a blissful state, you simply don't desire to change. But when in a negative state you will always desire to change to one that is blissful and at peace. The thing is that these positive emotions typically don't remain. Once experienced, they are then sought after once the effects wear off. You experience the meteor and you think of all the things you acquire including wealth and fortune, but the main reason you're happy is because of the relief of burden from working or from constantly stressing about money. 

Let's say you've already acquired a massive amount of wealth and had billionaire status, after stumbling upon that meteor you find the value is 10 million dollars. For the average person that would make them significantly happier than for you. Thus it's not the meteor or the money that matters, it's the relief from the burden of your responsibilities. If you wanted to just collect it and admire it you can do so, but then there's the idea of getting attached to those possessions. What if you stored it in your home, but while you were sleeping someone takes it. There would be another burden of having it and then losing it. Thus we have to go to a place where we can admire what's there without constantly wanting to possess. Because possessions are another illusion, you don't possess anything in this world. There is simply the concept of a possession, that's all there is. We think we own houses, money, wealth, knowledge but there is no ownership there. there are simply thoughts of those possessions.

```It's not that there is no "now", it is that "now" is all there is, but it is relative to the observer. We all talk in terms of past, present and future but, in reality, past and future are just thoughts we're having. Time appears linear because of our motion through space but, in reality, there is only one moment in which all possible configurations of space-time are true, simultaneously. This is why superposition is true. All configurations of space-time have to always be true for any one configuration to be measured, and, no, this does not mean multi-worlds or universes, just multiple relative perceptions/measurement/observations of a singular one where space-time can be configured differently, simultaneously. And the only time travel possible would be if another whole universe of energy was available to reconfigure the one we're in but you would not carry new knowledge, tech or anything else because the "past" configuration didn't have it, to begin with - which includes, possibly, your being.```

embeds.title: What Gravitational Waves Reveal About the Illusion of Time
embeds.description:
Gravitational waves can distort space and time, but their effects on humans are imperceptible unless the source event is catastrophic—by which point, it would already be too late to notice. The nature of time and simultaneity is relative, and the concept of "now" loses meaning at cosmic scales.

From 'Answering Questions about Hubble Tension, ...

content: one aspect of inspecting beliefs is not relying on conclusions set previously to assess them. The typical movement that people come across is that they assume their beliefs are incorrect before questioning them, they go into it assuming that the "I" is wrong. Instead of shooting down everything immediately you can just ask it naively. You only subtract santa when you see for yourself santa isn't real at the very moment, you don't constantly reject santa as a child hoping to disprove it or to eliminate it.

self inquiry itself is just going into the cave to inspect beliefs held. It’s inspecting what’s already there. These conceptions of lack such as a lack of career progress and not having what is desired is inquiry much along the same lines as going out on a beautiful field and walking around, but one has a negative connotation while the other doesn’t. it’s not that imagining a relationship is bad it’s that there is suffering because the desire of a relationship to “you” is unfulfilled. Inquiry itself is neither good or bad, the only thing that can be listed as negative is your own beliefs. A religious person will always defend that their god is the truth mainly based on their emotional attachment. When inspecting that their god isn’t real there is complete denial because of the attachment already in place. 

Inquiry is not setting out a solution or improving, it’s about questioning. Questions don’t have negativity, the negativity comes from beliefs that we hold about ourselves. It comes from unyielding curiosity about everything that is there. What are these words? why are words given weight? how are the words separate from me? what even is a word. You can inquire about everything because you are not separate from anything.

If you were in a relationship you wouldn’t suffer about the lack of one because the desire is fulfilled. But why does the negativity arise when the desire is unfulfilled. We are not separate from our desires, we are not separate from the unfulfillment. We are just here.

Inquiry is not a solution, just an inspection.

So why are you inquiring on these things at all? Would these questions take place if you were running through a field like a kid? Probably not, so based on the lack you feel bad and are inquiring to most likely feel better. And when the issue isn’t resolved there’s frustration of not resolving on top of these added identities within the mind.

It seems that a lot of the inquiry is based on a lack of fulfilling the desires of being elsewhere. And you are now attaching yourself onto that lack. If you had a relationship, had progress in your career, had more money and status what change would there be? The only change would be in relation to an imagined self that didn’t have those things before and has them now. But why does “having” something relieve you of any discomfort in the first place when that entire structure is sprouted from thinking of it? All suffering is based on not fulfilling desire, so we move away from what is and attach onto the imaginary space.

If I was to sit in my room and stare at my wall, that rises from desire and it’s the same if I was to doomscroll. We may desire to do other things or be in other places but those desires we may not be able to act upon or fulfill. The body for example desires naturally to be fed, it does not discriminate the calories that come in, but our desires do. 

Let’s say you are hungry for some fluffy chocolate chip waffles drizzled in maple syrup and topped with butter and we proceed to go to the pantry. When realizing that we’re out of batter, how do you act? For a moment you’ré in distraught but you’ll quickly adapt and move on to find something else that will substitute the desire for the specific food. If you desired the waffles strongly enough you’ll go to the store and get some. In either case you are fulfilling the desire in the moment.

It’s not that desire vanishes but the emotional latching onto it does. Desire itself is not a bad thing, people label some desires as good and others as bad but this is a bad attempt at evaluating the current condition. Some things we desire so strongly we feel empty if we don’t fulfill it such as a relationship with a partner or security in our bank accounts. What happens when we don’t fulfill these?

I would say that it’s not the inquiry that felt bad it’s the expected result which you seek to derive from the inquiry which left you empty. You may be looking for some projection of what you think the result is supposed to be like and looping infinitely trying to achieve it when the projection is illusory. What is desired from self inquiry that is not there right now? when doing self inquiry we’re uncovering things already there, not seeking to find a solution just questioning what already exists.
Even if they’re out partying or hiking or traveling, what change would there be if you were to do that? You would still be doing it now, so what difference would there be?

Something that’s interesting about fomo is observing what change there would be if you would experience what you’re imagined to miss. Usually when you imagine these things you’re imagining someone else doing something fun or something that you’re not involved in, but you wouldn’t enact this fear if they were doing something like cleaning their homes or something less fun.

this is an interesting question. overall any position that one is found in is really the only position that one can be in. There are no alternates for that. Let’s start with the first example, indeed if one was to get fired they would not have a job and thus what would that person do? There could be feelings associated with incompetence, shame, guilt etc. when placed in this circumstance it is not that there is thought of “who is the one that is homeless” but rather a detachment from these emotions that are undesirable. If one wants they will try to find a job, improve skills etc. the main thing is that one would undergo a lot of emotional havoc if they have attachment to the emotions and the other would simply look for another job without this baggage.

Next example with rape, why does one rape another. What is the reason for subjugating pressure onto the external world and moreover an individual that does not desire the same act. It starts with pleasure, pleasure is the sole characteristic and getting this pleasure at whatever cost. What makes someone go to such lengths for acquiring pleasure, it starts with the thought that satisfaction can be acquired externally instead of internally. This can be said the same for money, status, power. If one was completely satisfied with what’s there right now what else is there to do, act, acquire, and subjugate.

Lastly with the concentration camp, if one undergoes extreme pain and torture physically the immediate reaction is to stop the pain and what is wrong with that? Characterizing this whole thing as this invincible physical pain dissolution is a misunderstanding. If intense physical pain is there feeling like it’s hurting every nerve in the body, of course you will attempt to stop this pain. One doesn’t need to have an imaginary person in their head to feel some large physical discomfort. Just think or see any animal that feels intense discomfort and torture, they will want resolve it as they yell and scream.

mainly because there is no “after” or later from the current moment. There is no “what now” because that’s assuming an after and there has never been an after. There is no further seeking there are really no further external questions, because the disentangling all happens within

so the table is a concept being referenced, the outside is also being a concept being referenced. But both of these can only be referenced within thought, the key is there has never been anything outside of thought when referencing it. A baby sees a table for the first time, this morphing of a 3D structure into an identifiable object still has to occur within thought and then the recording comes based on it. 

You say there’s a table but you can only say that when thinking of the table. You say there’s an “outside” but you can only say that when thinking of an “outside” at all. The moment you think of outside it is still **inside** of thought and when that “outside” is experienced it’s still stored **inside**

When was it said that it was false? the pointer works fine, that’s not problematic and it doesn’t mean the thought is true or false. “If I imagine the table is key here”, can you imagine something or create an object of something outside of thinking of it? For a thing to be imagined it must be thought of even a concept like “unknown” which exists opposite of “known”. 

Whose to say something is true or false? What validation does this distinction do? Are you saying that because the pointer to the table makes sense that this entity “outside” also must make sense even if you’re not experiencing it?
just the simple identification, objectification is simply a stored image

“thing can still exist” - what thing exists apart from a belief that it exists, goes for anything. You see a human walking, you’ve objectified that thing walking as a human and you say it’s alive. The moment it goes into thought as an object it’s already a dead thing.
“something outside of imagination” - the outside or unknown is still contained via thought. You’ve objectified outside here have you not?

what is outside of what you perceive? You can say things like outer space, different galaxies, your parents, different objects but these are simply just externalizations or objects of imagination. Everything outside of what you perceive is simply a “dead thing”, it’s a result of an image that is not being experienced but there is a belief it is. The universe is simply thought in an outwards direction, ramana puts it beautifully “The mind, turned outwards, results in thoughts and objects. Turned inwards, it becomes itself the Self.”
why does it matter labeling someone you perceive as external
the true SR overlord

any depiction of your real self is not your real self. Thought cannot depict a real self because that lives in a division and division does not exist. 

The real self you are talking about is an object that you have externalized and associated with.
they only affect “you” if the “you” has been created within thought. If thought creates the thinker the only way thought affects “you” is if you imagine a “you” that can be affected

What is past or future apart from what you are thinking of the past and future right now? What need is there for a past and future at all to be constructed and latched onto. Experiencing the past and future does not make sense, these are thoughts that are simply concepts you are thinking now. You’re always thinking of the past now, you’re always thinking of the future now. There is no past ever experienced just as there’s no future ever experienced
this “beyond models and concepts” is just another model, see for yourself how cyclical you are making it. You want something beyond a concept which is another concept created
understanding the whole is quite counter, not understanding at all is really what it comes down to. Any time there is understanding there is always going to be limitation with the division
what do you mean beyond? Beyond what?

“Lots of new references” - there is only one reference really at a time, there is no lots of anything inside thought, you’re just thinking a thought at a time.

what is the real you? Sounds like a reference to a belief in contrast to a “fake you”. What is “think about myself”, who are you trying to capture or think of. What are you trying to contain for thought attempts to contain through the reference. 

Thoughts being references does not mean they are what they point to. You have a thought for a made up self or god or whatever concept, but what is it apart from a concept?

everytime you think of something it’s always a new thought. What is the same object can you point it down without thinking of it? If I say apple, that apple is always a new apple inside the thought. Even though it could refer to the “same” apple, but because the thought is always new it’s always a new reference which is all the thought is.

as per the dulling, there is inquiry that can be handled why there is an emotional response of anything at all in the first place? Anger, sadness, judgement, at the root why would these arise to some perceived external event
there’s no “same thoughts”, every time you think of a thought its always a new thought. The reference to the sensory input is always fresh, there is no same or consistency ever of a thought or input

Time is not something that is somewhere else, it's not external and only exists when you think of the concept. It only exists within the mind when thinking of it. So you have an exam, you're not doing the exam right now it can only be thought of or projected through imagination right now, of doing the exam. What is change? change is just an imagination of something changing, there is no such reality that's changing

let's see what a representation is, a representation is just what you're thinking right now of that "object" that you have constructed. But this doesn't signify anything because you cannot represent the "now", you can't even break down "now" and you certainly cannot symbolize it through words, concepts, or frameworks. So "planning about future" is just a thought you are thinking about some division you have created between right now and some projection of "not now" and that is entirely only a mental construct. There is no predicting the future because you are the only one that has thought of a future to predict. It's a complete isolation of a concept.

Concepts can only be divisions, and divisions don't really exist other than thinking of them. They serve no purpose, the purpose is simply a construction that is created by the mind.
reasons don’t matter, justifications don’t matter

any reason formulated is just another division through thought. It doesn’t really matter why, you can say for survival to make sure the apple is not poison or that the snake is real in the forest. This could translate to other areas where there aren’t real dangers, but the reasoning is not very important at all as it’s just another concept

concepts are not representative of anything, they are divisions inherent only when thinking about them. there are no divisions when interfacing with what's there right now. An apple is a concept only in understanding, understanding is not necessary at all for life. The concept is just created through the mind relating a connection to a sensory perception, nothing more or less. Through the concept you cannot see, smell, hear etc but you think you can and that allows you to "predict" or at least eat the apple in the wild if you see one next time

but I’m confused as to whose conception of the alphabet are you referring to. Because your conception of alphabet is completely different than the alien. His conception could be a spherical object with grooves raised 3 millimeters and your conception could be smooth object that I got hit in the face by Lucy when you were 4 years old

what is experiencing you for 2 seconds? let’s even say for 1 moment, it doesn’t even have to be 2 seconds. What is the confusion in this scenario. If one swaps with you for 1 moment, they are downloading it anyways because memory is always there. 

There really is no isolation. Let’s say you are growing up learning words. Then alphabet has to be understood, the conception of the word in relationship to the alphabet, the stringing of connections. but that understanding of the word is not even yours to begin with, the brain has been conditioned not even by you for specific qualities of pleasure and pain and so forth. Let’s say that alien boiled his hand while he was switching with you for that 1 moment, that doesn’t need to be learned for pain to be understood.

To summarize, if the alien switched with you for 1 moment he would just be perceiving whatever sensory information is available. Nothing more and nothing less. But if a thought arises of a basketball, how can that thought be an isolation of just an object. The basketball only exists in connection to the conception surrounding the basketball. Maybe it’s just an orange basketball or maybe it’s lebron dunking a basketball

the alien is like a sponge in this scenario, he absorbed the memories and reverted to his alien self. Then you ask a question recalling the memory because you’re befuddled. The alien says yeah I know that, I’m recalling it right now. When the alien switches back he’s not still downloading the data he’s just recalling it now like a human does right now.

So if I used capy’s example of pink elephant, you are now thinking of a pink elephant. It’s just a trigger just like when the person said to the alien “I was bullied through high school”. 

He switched back but the memories of that even are recalled now. And the same as the trigger “two terrible relationships” 

One step further is that when you eat a pizza it’s interesting how we recall it now. On one side we think we’re recalling a person eating a pizza sort of like third person, but we’re actually just recalling the sight, taste, smell of the pizza without any “you” there. So in the example of the “bullied” in high school the raw data is just the loud sounds that were received during the “bullying”
